moves.1. d4 Nf6: I don't know this opening so I just wing it by playing what feels natural
moves.2. c4: Starting with sticking another pawn in the middle.
moves.2... g6 3. Nc3 Bg7 4. e4: I have an impressive pawn center, but can it hold?
moves.4... d6 5. d5 Nbd7: This blocks in blacks LSB, but it's still the best square for the knight.
moves.9. Bd3 Ncd7: If he wanted his knight there why did he move it?
moves.10... c6 11. Bxf6: I felt the center was locked up enough for this exchange.
moves.14. b5 c5 15. Qb3: Now I'm almost finished with development, and black doesn't even have his LSB out. It doesn't come out until move 27.
moves.15... a5 16. O-O-O: I actually felt queenside was safer because it was locked up.
moves.19. g5 Bg7 20. gxf6: So I snaffle up his knight
moves.20... Bxf6: I would have used the queen
moves.21. h5 g5 22. Rdg1 h6 23. Ng3: Bringing another piece into the attack
moves.23... Bg7 24. Nf5 Qf6 25. Qc2: Preparing to swing over to the kingside.
moves.25... Bh8: Black's position is like a sheet of glass, if you push too hard it will crack, and if you push even harder it will shatter. In this game, it does.
moves.29. fxg4 Qg5+: This looks like it wins back the pawn but it doesn't.
moves.30. Qd2 Qxg4: ??????? How many question marks would you like to give this?
moves.31. Rg2 Qxg2 32. Qxg2+: And bam! Black's position has cracked badly, I have an open file to his king.
moves.32... Bg7 33. Rg1: Doubling up, but better would have been advancing my f pawn.
moves.35... Rg8: Adding more defense to the bishop
moves.37... Rxf7 38. Qxf7: If I was black I'd resign now, but he plays on
moves.38... Kh7 39. Rg6 Kh8: Black is reduced to shunting his king back and forth.
moves.40. d6 Kh7 41. Rxf6: Taking advantage of the pinned bishop
moves.43. d7: The bishop blocks the rook from attacking the promotion square
moves.43... Rg1+: He keeps playing until the checks run out. There's no need for further annotation. Please drop a comment and rate it on the star system.
